snippet: South Africa’s government is pushing a measure to give traditional courts the force of law.
abstract: South Africa’s government is pushing a measure to give traditional courts the force of law, compelling people in many rural areas to appear before them to answer charges that they have violated community traditions; fierce debate over the bill has exposed a fault line running deep in South African society between traditionalists and a racially diverse but largely Westernized cultural establishment that fears a return to traditional values will trample hard-won constitutional rights.
lead_paragraph: South Africa’s government is pushing a measure to give traditional courts the force of law.
